      • extractNER

        public static Span extractNER(List<CoreLabel> tokens,
                              Span seed)
        Returns a coherent NER span from a list of tokens.
        Parameters:
        tokens - The tokens of the entire sentence.
        seed - The seed span of the intended NER span that should be expanded.
        Returns:
        A 0 indexed span corresponding to a coherent NER chunk from the given seed.

      • cleanTree

        public static List<SemanticGraphEdge> cleanTree(SemanticGraph tree)
        Fix some bizarre peculiarities with certain trees. So far, these include:
        • Sometimes there's a node from a word to itself. This seems wrong.
        Parameters:
        tree - The tree to clean (in place!).
        Returns:
        A list of extra edges, which are valid but were removed.

      • stripPrepCases

        public static void stripPrepCases(SemanticGraph tree)
        Strip away case edges, if the incoming edge is a preposition. This replicates the behavior of the old Stanford dependencies on universal dependencies.
        Parameters:
        tree - The tree to modify in place.

      • isCyclic

        public static boolean isCyclic(SemanticGraph tree)
        Determine if a tree is cyclic.
        Parameters:
        tree - The tree to check.
        Returns:
        True if the tree has at least once cycle in it.

      • isTree

        public static boolean isTree(SemanticGraph tree)
        A little utility function to make sure a SemanticGraph is a tree.
        Parameters:
        tree - The tree to check.
        Returns:
        True if this SemanticGraph is a tree (versus a DAG, or Graph).

      • nerOverlap

        public static boolean nerOverlap(List<CoreLabel> tokens,
                                 Span a,
                                 Span b,
                                 Optional<SemanticGraph> parse)
        Returns true if the given two spans denote the same consistent NER chunk. That is, if we call extractNER(List, Span) on these two spans, they would return the same span.
        Parameters:
        tokens - The tokens in the sentence.
        a - The first span.
        b - The second span.
        parse - The parse tree to traverse looking for coreference chains to exploit.
        Returns:
        True if these two spans contain exactly the same NER.

      • nerOverlap

        public static boolean nerOverlap(List<CoreLabel> tokens,
                                 Span a,
                                 Span b)
        See Also:
        nerOverlap(List, Span, Span, Optional)

      • dumpAccuracy

        public static void dumpAccuracy(Classifier<ClauseSplitter.ClauseClassifierLabel,String> classifier,
                                GeneralDataset<ClauseSplitter.ClauseClassifierLabel,String> dataset)
        A helper function for dumping the accuracy of the trained classifier.
        Parameters:
        classifier - The classifier to evaluate.
        dataset - The dataset to evaluate the classifier on.

      • tokensToSpan

        public static Span tokensToSpan(List<? extends HasIndex> tokens)
        Construct the spanning span of the given list of tokens.
        Parameters:
        tokens - The tokens that should define the span.
        Returns:
        A span (0-indexed) that covers all of the tokens.
